image.altText: group of police and search crews and police cars

props.synopsis: A man has been found safe and well after surviving three days in the remote Kimberley outback, as temperatures soared past 38 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Man survives three days lost in remote Kimberley outback in searing heat

image.altText: Australian personnel approach one of the boats at Kuri Bay.

props.synopsis: A local fishing tour operator alerted Australian Border Force after his colleague spotted what appeared to be a foreign boat in mangroves about 370km north-west of Broome.

title.children: Reports of illegal foreign fishing vessel in WA's remote north

image.altText: A middle aged white woman with long blonde hair sitting on a park bench

props.synopsis: Annual drug overdose deaths in Australia have almost doubled over the past 20 years. Advocates say it’s time governments change the way they tackle the issue.

title.children: When police came to her door, Jen was worried her daughter had been arrested. The reality was far worse

image.altText: A composite image of Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins.

props.synopsis: The witnesses have wrapped up their evidence and the legal teams are preparing their final pitches to the judge as the mammoth defamation trial between WA Senator Linda Reynolds and her ex-staffer Brittany Higgins nears its end. Here's what we've learned.

title.children: Seven key takeaways from Linda Reynolds's blockbuster defamation case against Brittany Higgins

image.altText: A man with dark hair holds the face of a serious looking woman with blonde hair and blue eyes

props.synopsis: Any efforts to kickstart conversations about abuse should be applauded. But as a serious reflection of what domestic violence is really like, It Ends With Us falls short.

title.children: The truth of violent marriages is lost when Hollywood refuses to face the dark reality

image.altText: Three people wearing scrubs and gloves standing around a metal stretcher.

props.synopsis: Embalming is not a job for the faint-hearted, but for Blaine Little and his colleagues, the satisfaction of giving people's loved ones another goodbye is a special part of a fulfilling career.

title.children: Life, death and fitting farewells all part of the job for dedicated 'last responders'

image.altText: A wide shot of large plastic-wrapped packages containing cocaine, taped up with AFP tape, at a media conference.

props.synopsis: A man who was part of an operation to import half a tonne of cocaine into WA is sentenced to 22 years in prison.

title.children: Man sentenced to 22 years in jail after 'extremely serious' role in plot to import 560kg of cocaine into WA

image.altText: An e-scooter parked on grass near a beach.

props.synopsis: Almost 200 people presented to a regional hospital with e-scooter injuries in Western Australia's north in the space of 12 months, a study has found.

title.children: Intoxication a major factor as tourist town records close to 200 e-scooter injuries in 12 months

image.altText: Lia FInocchiaro addresses the CLP election night party.

props.synopsis: Lia Finocchiaro will be the first female chief minister for the Country Liberal Party, describing the landslide victory as "an absolute honour and a privilege".

title.children: CLP wins 2024 NT election, returns to power after eight years in opposition

image.altText: young man sitting on a hospital bed with multiple burns across his face, chest and arms

props.synopsis: Jensen Kirby was headed for the remote Telo Islands in northern Sumatra for a surfing trip when the boat he was travelling on exploded in flames. What followed was a race to find medical care before it was too late.

title.children: Surfer describes ordeal after boat explosion left him severely burnt on remote island

image.altText: Solingen stabbing Germany

props.synopsis: Three people are dead and at least five are injured after being stabbed at a festival in the western Germany city of Solingen.

title.children: Stabbing attack that killed three at German festival 'possible act of terrorism'

image.altText: Chris Pearson portrait

props.synopsis: An inquiry ordered following a Four Corners investigation into the Public Trustee concluded that the agency's actions "in the main … were appropriate". Refunds and a misplaced account tell a different story.

title.children: Facing questions from the ABC, the Public Trustee found a client's misplaced account containing $73,000

image.altText: Chris Fagan walking on the Gabba after a Lions' AFL match.

props.synopsis: The Lions get home by 20 points against the Bombers at the Gabba, but coach Chris Fagan is less than impressed as his side turns its attention to the finals.

title.children: ‘Shouldn't have been as close as it was’: Lions concerned about form after tense win over Bombers

image.altText: A couple stand on top of a mountain

props.synopsis: Summer holiday destinations are now targeting the hearts and wallets of winter travellers in an effort to create a more sustainable tourism model.

title.children: Summer tourist hotspots shift their focus to spruiking winter getaways

image.altText: Takuya Shiota wears full PPE including a breathing mask with a white hood tightened around the outside of his face as he cleans.

props.synopsis: Dying a lonely death is an increasing problem in Japan, and it's not just due to its aging population, with a lack of community among the factors isolating people.

title.children: As Japan ages, a terrifying proposition is emerging: Dying alone and no-one finding your body for years

image.altText: A yellow sign says footpath closed and yellow

props.synopsis: Seismologist Michael Turnbull predicts "reasonably sized" earthquakes of at least magnitude 3 could hit the area for the next couple of months.

title.children: Aftershocks expected to rattle the NSW Upper Hunter for months

image.altText: A man sits in the steps of a bus

props.synopsis: Danny Reinhold couldn't afford to rent a permanent home. His fight to live in a bus has led to a rule change for temporary homes that will help others at risk of rough sleeping.

title.children: A WA pensioner took on the law and won the right to live in his bus, sparking a statewide rule change

image.altText: A woman surrounded by balloons

props.synopsis: Harris doesn't have time to mess around. Biden's last-minute withdrawal from the race has left her with a very limited window to sell herself to undecided voters. It also leaves less time to rebound from any stumbles.

title.children: Just a day after Kamala Harris's big party, the dynamics of the US election have shifted again

image.altText: Black writing on a white piece of paper with blue reflections

props.synopsis: Despite cuts to regulated power prices, some consumers are paying more than double the benchmark. Advocates say the system is broken.

title.children: Advocates decry 'failing' protections for energy consumers as some pay 'double' benchmark price

image.altText: Belinda, wearing sunglasses and a white and blue dress (Left) and Vienna wearing a blue singlet and sunglasses (right).

props.synopsis: Vienna was diagnosed with Primary Ovarian Insufficiency (POI) at 19. But the lack of awareness about the rare condition is causing severe delays in diagnosis, putting young women's lives at risk.

title.children: Experiencing menopause symptoms before 40 can be a nightmare without answers for women with POI

image.altText: To Lam sitting down on a chair with two microphones in front of him on a lectern.

props.synopsis: Former minister of public security To Lam has rapidly ascended to power in Vietnam, taking on two of the four roles considered the "pillars" of the country's political system. Some are already comparing him to Xi Jinping.

title.children: To Lam was once parodied after being fed steak by Salt Bae. He's now the most powerful man in Vietnam

image.altText: Sumaya Abu Ghaliba sits on a hospital bed with daylight coming in a window behind her.

props.synopsis: Children like Sumaya are among the thousands estimated to have lost a limb in the nine months of the Gaza war, and doctors say the situation inside some hospitals is so bad they're sometimes amputating without anaesthesia.

title.children: When morphine ran out in Gaza, doctors say amputations became a 'never-ending nightmare'

image.altText: Two prisoners of war draped in Ukraine flags embrace after being released

props.synopsis: It is the seventh such exchange the UAE has mediated since Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022.

title.children: First prisoner swap since Ukraine incursion into Russia sees 230 people released

image.altText: Machinery digs up the tram tracks along Glenelg's Jetty Road.

props.synopsis: The potentially politically explosive overhaul is the first major shift in commonwealth-state land transport infrastructure funding arrangements since 2019.

title.children: States and territories to pay more for major infrastructure projects under secretive new deal

image.altText: Fire and Rescue department use crane to dig.

props.synopsis: A woman is believed to have been swept away by water underneath Malaysia's capital after falling into a sinkhole which opened up in the pavement where she was walking.

title.children: Woman disappears down sinkhole in Malaysia's capital

image.altText: Kalyn Ponga holds the ball in both hands during an 2024 NRL match for the Newcastle Knights.

props.synopsis: Kalyn Ponga inspires Newcastle to a 36-16 victory over South Sydney, with the result keeping the 11th-placed Knights in the race for a finals berth.

title.children: 'He's just got a look about him': Why Ponga is giving Knights hope of making finals

image.altText: A crowd of onlookers - mostly couples in their 30s - wearing puffer jackets and holding umbrellas along a residential street.

props.synopsis: Many hopeful homebuyers turn up at property auctions every weekend just to see the price soar beyond their expectations and out of their reach. But is it underquoting?

title.children: 'Thousands duped every weekend':  'Widespread' problem bringing homebuyers to tears

image.altText: A man posing alongside a young girl. Both are smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: It comes one day after the body of Mike Lynch's 18-year-old daughter Hannah was recovered from the site of the shipwreck.

title.children: Manslaughter inquiry launched after sinking of Mike Lynch's family superyacht

image.altText: A national weather map showing most of Australia red, with the southern and eastern coastline mostly yellow

props.synopsis: Above-average temperatures of up to 17 degrees Celsius were recorded in Australia this week. But with a polar blast on the horizon, the warm weather could be gone as fast as it came.

title.children: Battle of the seasons erupts this week, with polar blast risking end to sudden warm weather

image.altText: A warlord with a massive beard drives an modern-looking car

props.synopsis: Ramzan Kadyrov's relationship with Vladimir Putin means he can run Chechnya as his own personal fiefdom and launch strange publicity stunts like mounting a machine gun to a Tesla Cybertruck.

title.children: The 'Kremlin dragon', a Tesla truck and an offended Elon Musk: Putin's bad week takes an odd turn

image.altText: Yemen's Houthi rebels release video claiming to have set oil-tanker on fire

props.synopsis: Fires were spotted on a Greek-flagged oil tanker in the Red Sea one day after rescuers evacuated its crew in the wake of an assault by Yemen's Houthi rebels.

title.children: Fires rage on board Greek-flagged tanker in Red Sea, one day after Yemeni Houthis attack

image.altText: People holding large placards in the midday sun

props.synopsis: Residents of Little River say 1,500 freight trucks per day and a warehouse for shipping containers will ruin their quiet, country lifestyle as well as endanger wildlife.

title.children: Residents of a small town outside Melbourne are fighting a proposal to build a major freight terminal on their doorstep

image.altText: A woman in bikini holding shots smiling to camera.

props.synopsis: An Indonesian citizen who often went by the name Putry Thornhill has been sentenced to an 18-month community correction order over counterfeit luxury designer handbags. But other alleged victims say justice hasn't been done.

title.children: Alleged serial fraudster sentenced to 18-month corrections order but not everybody's happy

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie Stateline interview

props.synopsis: Just months after the Tasmanian election, two of the three Jacqui Lambie Network MPs are kicked out of the party following a "challenging" week with the firebrand senator, and say they will stay on as independents.

title.children: Lambie's Tasmanian party implodes with two MPs kicked out
